Exporting Report Data

You can export application data displayed in the upper pane for use in spreadsheets and other applications. Because only 60 columns can be displayed in the upper pane, you are limited to exporting 60 columns.

Databases have limitations as well. It is wise to verify that the application in which you intend to use the exported data can accept all 60 columns.

To create text files that can be imported into Access, Excel, or other applications:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select a component tab.

  3. Select Advanced > Export from the component context menu or select Export from the Audit menu.

    4. The Export dialog displays two lists. The Available fields list box contains all the fields that could be shown as column headers, but are not currently displayed. The Show these fields in this order list box displays all the fields that are currently displayed.

  4. To add fields to the report, select fields from the Available fields list, and click Add.

  5. To remove fields from the report, select fields from the Show these fields in this order list box, and click Remove.

    6. Tips: Double-clicking a field name moves it from one list box to the other.

  6. To change the order of the fields to be displayed in the report, drag each field name to the desired location in the Show these fields in this order list box.

  7. Select the Current selection option button in the Export for group box to create the report using only the items selected from the upper pane. Choose the Select all option button to use all items displayed in the upper pane.

  8. Select the Export field names check box to include the column header fields selected in the report. Clear this check box to exclude column header fields from the report.

  9. Select the Replace Embedded Carriage Returns With Spaces check box if you want to remove any carriage returns that may be embedded in text fields from the exported data.

  10. Enter a qualifier in the Text qualifier text box. The qualifier will be used at both ends of the text fields, to prevent the special treatment for carriage return/line feeds and special characters that occur in HTML output.

  11. Select a character to separate the data from the Delimiter drop-down list box.

  12. In the Output file name text box, enter or browse for the report name and location. Be sure to use .txt or another appropriate extension. If you use no extension, the file will have a .txt extension.

  13. Click OK to generate the report.

  14. Open the report in the application you have selected and, if desired, print it.
